perturbation.original_text:
1.1. Franchisor hereby grants to Developer, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement (if
Section 2.20 is applicable add “, and specifically Section 2.20 hereof,”) and as long as Developer shall not be
in default of this Agreement or any other development, franchise or other agreement between Developer and
Franchisor, (non-exclusive/exclusive) development rights to establish and operate ____ franchised restaurant(s),
and to use the El Pollo Loco® System solely in connection therewith, at specific locations to be designated in
separate Franchise Agreement(s) (the “Franchise Agreements”).
perturbation.changed_text:
1.1. Franchisor hereby grants to Developer, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement (if
Section 2.20 is applicable add “, and specifically Section 2.20 hereof,”) and as long as Developer shall not be
in default of this Agreement or any other development, franchise or other agreement between Developer and
Franchisor, (non-exclusive/exclusive) development rights to establish and operate ____ franchised restaurant(s),
and to use the El Pollo Loco® System solely in connection therewith, at specific locations to be designated in
separate Restaurant Agreement(s) (the “Franchise Agreements”).
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'Franchise Agreement' to 'Restaurant Agreement' creates confusion. While it renames the agreement, it retains the original parenthetical reference to 'Franchise Agreements', leading to a contradiction. It’s now unclear what type of agreement is being referenced, which creates uncertainty in the franchisee's obligations, rights, and expectations, and the legal ramifications of the new type of agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
2.3. Although this Agreement affords the Developer the right to develop and open El Pollo Loco®
restaurant(s) within the Territory, as set forth on Exhibit “A”, all Restaurant(s) developed under this Agreement
must be duly licensed through individual Franchise Agreement(s). Developer will execute El Pollo Loco’s then
standard Franchise Agreement in use at the time of execution for each restaurant developed under this
Agreement, and agrees to pay Franchisor the current fees, royalties and other required payments in accordance
with the Franchise Agreement and Franchise Disclosure Document then in effect.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.3. Although this Agreement affords the Developer the right to develop and open El Pollo Loco®
restaurant(s) within the Territory, as set forth on Exhibit “A”, all Restaurant(s) developed under this Agreement
must be duly licensed through individual Restaurant Permit(s). Developer will execute El Pollo Loco’s then
standard Franchise Agreement in use at the time of execution for each restaurant developed under this
Agreement, and agrees to pay Franchisor the current fees, royalties and other required payments in accordance
with the Franchise Agreement and Franchise Disclosure Document then in effect.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'Franchise Agreement' to 'Restaurant Permit' creates a contradiction. It now mentions that all restaurant(s) developed must be duly licensed through individual Restaurant Permit(s), but it continues that Developer will execute El Pollo Loco's then standard Franchise Agreement. This contradiction causes uncertainty as to what the developer must execute, and what agreement holds them liable.

perturbation.original_text:

perturbation.changed_text:
2.4. Developer must satisfy all Franchisor’s financial and operational criteria then in effect and in addition, if
Developer is also a Licensee of one or more El Pollo Loco Restaurants, Franchisee must also be in good
standing with Franchisor and satisfy all Franchisor’s financial and operational criteria then in effect prior to El Pollo
Loco's execution of each standard Franchise Agreement issued pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Franchisee' and 'Licensee' are used in the same sentence, with the latter replacing the former, creating a conflict. The text also mentions how Developer must be in good standing prior to El Pollo Loco's execution of each standard Franchise Agreement, even though the prior term was 'Licensee'. This generates confusion over the franchisee's actual standing in order to execute each standard Franchise Agreement.
